snippet: The party, led by Marine Le Pen, has thrived on an anti-immigration message and is projected to win two of France’s 13 regions and is leading in several others.
abstract: Ultra-right National Front party gains advantage in first round of French regional elections; organization, led by Marine Le Pen, is expected to maintain lead in second round of voting due to its anti-immigration and anti-Muslim platform, which have increasing appeal in wake of Paris attacks.

byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden and Lilia Blaise contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The party, led by Marine Le Pen, has thrived on an anti-immigration message and is projected to win two of France’s 13 regions and is leading in several others.

headline.main: France’s Far-Right National Front Gains in Regional Elections
headline.print_headline: France’s Far-Right National Front Gains in Elections
